Posted By: MrBarrelRoll (10/3/2011 12:12:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The name looks to be a throwback to [Soulscour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soulscour). I think I like this better just because of the tricks you can pull with it, but Soulscour is definitely more of a game over button if it resolves. Especially with the artifact lands you had access to back then.  
  
I'm intrigued why they used "all permanents except artifacts and lands" opposed to " all nonland, nonartifact permanents". See [Planar Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planar Cleansing) and [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress). It couldn't have been a syntax change because 7th version Duress used the same format. Was it an actual rules issue or just a random thing?  
  
Oh, did I mention this works well with [Sharuum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sharuum) and [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter)? You could also [Prototype Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prototype Portal) with [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) to get 2x the tokens. And this dies to removal. (Don't you love the Gatherer echos?)
posts.html:
The name looks to be a throwback to Soulscour. I think I like this better just because of the tricks you can pull with it, but Soulscour is definitely more of a game over button if it resolves. Especially with the artifact lands you had access to back then.

I'm intrigued why they used "all permanents except artifacts and lands" opposed to " all nonland, nonartifact permanents". See Planar Cleansing and Duress. It couldn't have been a syntax change because 7th version Duress used the same format. Was it an actual rules issue or just a random thing?

Oh, did I mention this works well with Sharuum and Master Transmuter? You could also Prototype Portal with Doubling Season to get 2x the tokens. And this dies to removal. (Don't you love the Gatherer echos?)
